reviews.review_msg: I fell asleep in most of the lectures and didn't attend a handful of them. I think the only reason I was able to pass with a B was because I went to high school in BC (therefore studied Canadian history and society). The term paper is really hard. Don't leave it to the last minute.

Nice guy but the driest lectures you could ever imagine. Miserably boring, slow-paced class with very little discussion. Tutorials are useless. Exams are unreasonable (2 essays in 1 hour) and there's a huge term paper. Also get ready to be buried under boring long readings all semester and not be instructed. Would not recommend this class with him.

Karl is an amazing person: the kind of guy you should spark a conversation with after class. Though, his lectures are dry; the readings are all over the place; and he requires a LOT of reading (I am an avid reader, and I found it a lot). He's an easy marker, thank goodness! If he was a hard marker this course would not be doable. Not for first year

Karl was one of the best teachers you can have at SFU, even though his lectures were really long and gets out of the topic as long as you stay on track with his course outline you'll be fine! One of the teachers that I would always wanted to have class with.
Really nice guy, always there to help and gives great feedback.  Lectures can be a little dry though.
Dry, boring lectures with long boring, readings. Would not recommend this class.

I enjoyed reading the textbook and the course material was very interesting. He is a really nice professor and the amount of work required for the class was fair. I found it to be a pretty easy class. I found I would start getting restless partway through the class (it was 4 hours long in the evenings). He has a very mellow tone. But he was easy
He makes me want to sleep. ONLY take it if it required.

He is a nice man , I feel bad saying this but as a proff he is not good! he speaks in a low voice which makes you sleepy and the material are not quite clear. I still got a good mark so I think he is an easy marker but his lectures were so borringggg its was like torture

He has a very quiet voice that would put me asleep at 8:30am. He would only cover 2-8 slides in 2hrs. I attended every lecture before the midterm and did horrible. I didn't attend any after and just did my readings and I did better.

His lectures are very dry, but it relates well to the readings. I wouldn't recommend buying the custom courseware at SFU bookstore, because they are available in cheaper prices online from previous students. His midterms are outrageous, 1 hour to write 2 essays, and no essay question preparation beforehand. Only recommend it if it is compulsory!

Mr. Froschauer specializes in sociological issues in Canada and is familiar with the course material. If you can listen through his lullaby of a voice, you'll learn a lot from his detailed examples. There is a lot of readings, but it's all relevant. Don't buy the pricey custom courseware, most of the articles are in the library (books & databases).
Really nice guy and easy course requirements (don't know how this counts as a W). He was kind of a rambler and not particularly engaging.
I found him not familiar with this lecture materials, he's like reading his lecture slides in no orders, very unorganized and boring.

The lectures could get a bit dry at times. People were actually leaving at the first break because of this. No feedback on the biweekly assignments, which I would have preferred. Other than that, Karl gives great opportunities to speak in class and likes to hear from other perspectives.
I found his lecture unorganized...so hard to follow up, he switches topic very fast, and can not explain the concepts and his opinions clearly
not bad. really boring guy, but do the readings and you would get an A
the pro is not that interesting, but the content of the course is not bad!
if you take this course for W/B credits, i would say, you 'd better not....
useless!!!! his class is so so so so so boring!!!!

This class was extremely dry, even for the interesting content. Whether it was because it was at 8:30 in the morning, or because of his deep monotone voice repeating things we already read, neither I nor anyone else around me enjoyed this class. That being said, it's a good GPA booster if you do the readings. Take your pick: GPA booster v. boredom.

Class was super chill. Take the tutorial with prof.froschauer!!!! basically you read come up with questions and discuss them in tutorial. Mid terms and finals are easy if you do the readings and use the sub-headings. im first year and i found this to be a great course for the transistion from high school to uni

This course was required for my degree and I did not want to take it; however the material was suprisingly interesting. He's a really nice professor (he was my tutorial leader also) and basically summarizes the text for you in class. So if you don't want to read you have to go to class. If you read the articles tutorials will be easy.

BEST professor ive had at SFU so far! His exams are easy. He takes the key headings from the text, and you can bs your way through it. Tutorials were pointless, but overall best class ive ever had (and trust me, I dont have the best GPA, but I got an A in this class). I strongly recommend this for a first year student or easy elective ;)

Great professor to have for any sociology course. Would definitely take him again in the future if possible. However, he encourages participation from all students since it also counts for marks in the course. I would've gotten an A- if I talked more...
Horrible teacher. Disorganized, doesn't explain new or difficult concepts well. Makes an already dry subject outright painful.
Nice,  easy to understand prof.  Midterms/exams are easy.  Easy essays (maybe the course is just easy...).  But doesn't complicate things and makes sure u know the basics.

Good teacher. His lectures can be dry, but he's trying!! He has these laughs once in a while..haha..but that's a good thing!!..yup..his midterms..essays..in just one hour!!!!INSANE!!..Again, the tutorials helped!

A very good professor when compared to SFU newly appointed ones. Course readings are at an acceptable level and not overloading his students. He encourages Q&A and discussions during class and will explain to students when new terms are used/introduced during discussion by students. He listens attentively to foreign students and help them to suceed

material is dry... can't understand what hes saying sometimes... doesnt really feel like a 100 level course.. midterm is awkward (2 essays in 1 hour T_T )hes very friendly and easy to talk with... if hes going to do powerpoint should atleast put notes on webct... sometimes likes to wander off topic... otherwise not the worst proff i've had at sfu.

text is from 1994, based on 1981 survey & has not changed as evidence by previous notes in library copy. Remember Cdn Charter not until 1982 yet 1 of the course topics is "gender" (not really; just women in workplace) & another, 1997 immigration of Chinese to Canada.....what the hell?!  This guy can't even answer Q's w/o quoting the outdated text.

He's a very kind and gentel teacher .. very easy to talk to. His lecutres can be a bit unclear sometimes, but asking him questions insn't scary. Although there are a lot of readings to be done and assignments.
good prof, some funny jokes, very helpful if you needed it
He is a excellent professor and I found him to be very helpful and insightful with the material that he distributed for this course. I also think that he's handsome..nice on the eyes.

BLAHHH. The content of this course was extremely dry, and this prof did nothing to really make it seem interesting. Bored me to tears. I fell asleep during his lectures. Seemed kind of cold and unavailable.
Looks like Sean Connery! nice guy. Think it's just the class info that's boring, he teaches well lots of info. essays/tests fair if u do ur work.
He is a very kind and interesting person, not the most computer saavy person but he will push you to understand even the most abstract of concepts.

Hated this class..There was a lot of stuff to know, and this Prof was very unclear in all of the email contact I had with him. Very unorganized class. I don't know about the lecture course, but never take this class by distance.
It was CDE for me but I felt he kept the students at an arm's length - not very helpful.  He was clear though and knows what he's talking about.
Unfortunately, stacks up as one of my least favorites. I found his lectures very disorganized, and his stance slightly unclear. Recommend al alternate teacher for this class
good class, but i dont like the guy.
Way too socialist for my liking, but a very kind and intelligent individual.
